meanings.definition: To make more humane or kind.
meanings.sent1: The teacher humanized the classroom by showing kindness to all students.
meanings.sent2: The volunteers humanized the shelter by caring for the animals with love and compassion.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to humanize its responses, but ended up complimenting the toaster.
meanings.sent4: The artist humanized the cityscape with vibrant colors and friendly faces.
meanings.sent5: The act of kindness humanized the stranger in the eyes of the community.

meanings.definition: To give a human character or attribute to.
meanings.sent1: The author humanized the main character by giving them relatable emotions and struggles.
meanings.sent2: The animator humanized the cartoon character by adding expressions and gestures.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog in the movie tried to humanize itself by wearing sunglasses and a hat.
meanings.sent4: The artist humanized the tree by painting a face on its trunk.
meanings.sent5: The child's imagination humanized the stuffed animals, giving them personalities and voices.
